item.title: 苹果两年来首次发行债券成为繁忙初选的头条新闻
item.description: 根据美国证券交易委员会（SEC）的文件，苹果公司周一宣布发行四期债券，这是其两年来首次发行债券，预计募集资金将用于回购股票、偿还未偿债务及其他用途。【原文：Apple on Monday announced a four-tranche bond offering, its first in two years, with proceeds expected to be used to repurchase stock, repay outstanding debt among other purposes, according to its SEC filing.】

item.title: 贝森特表示，特朗普的关税、减税和放松管制议程将推动投资流向美国
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周一表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税、减税和放松管制议程将共同推动对美国经济的长期投资，并补充说美国金融市场是 "反脆弱 "的，将经受住任何短期动荡的考验。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Monday said President Donald Trump's tariff, tax-cut and deregulation agenda would work together to drive long-term investment to the U.S. economy, adding that U.S. financial markets were "antifragile" and would weather any short-term turbulence.】

item.title: 通用汽车任命内部人士邓肯-奥尔德里德（Duncan Aldred）领导北美业务
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周一任命内部人士邓肯-奥尔德里德（Duncan Aldred）为北美业务总裁，立即生效，几天前该汽车制造商因担心美国关税而下调了 2025 年的利润预期。【原文：General Motors on Monday named insider Duncan Aldred the president of its North America business, effective immediately, days after the automotive manufacturer cut its 2025 profit forecast on concerns over U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 墨西哥制定措施避免钢铁和纺织品倾销
item.description: 墨西哥经济部长马塞洛-埃布拉德（Marcelo Ebrard）周一表示，墨西哥已采取措施打击大量低价进口钢铁和纺织品的行为，这种行为被称为倾销。【原文：Mexico has rolled out measures to fight against a flood of low-cost imports of steel and textiles, Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Monday, a practice known as dumping.】

item.title: 以色列 eToro 在美国 IPO 的目标估值为 40 亿美元
item.description: 以色列 eToro 集团周一表示，其在美国首次公开募股的目标估值高达 40 亿美元。【原文：Israel's eToro Group said on Monday it was targeting a valuation of up to $4 billion in its initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 美国服务业 4 月份回暖；价格压力上升
item.description: 由于订单增加，4月份美国服务业增长回升，从而推动衡量企业支付材料和服务价格的指标达到两年多来的最高水平，这表明关税导致的通胀压力正在增加。【原文：The U.S. services sector's growth picked up in April as orders increased, boosting a measure of prices paid by businesses for materials and services to the highest level in more than two years, signaling a building up in inflation pressures due to tariffs.】

item.title: 意大利时装集团 OTB 评估在美国的涨价幅度
item.description: 意大利时装集团 OTB 旗下拥有 Diesel、Jil Sander 和 Maison Margiela 等品牌，该集团首席执行官周一表示，如果贸易关税得到确认，该集团正在评估在美国的提价幅度。【原文：Italian fashion group OTB, which owns brands such as Diesel, Jil Sander and Maison Margiela, is assessing the extent of price increases in the United States if trade tariffs are confirmed, the group's CEO said on Monday.】

item.title: 芯片制造商 Onsemi 预测季度营收将因电动汽车制造商的强劲需求而增长
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对汽车进口征收关税给经济带来了不确定性，但电动汽车用芯片的需求依然保持强劲，因此 Onsemi 公司周一预计第二季度营收将高于华尔街预期。【原文：Onsemi forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations on Monday, as demand for its chips used in electric vehicles remains resilient despite economic uncertainty brought on by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on auto imports.】

item.title: 鞋类品牌 Skechers 将在 90 亿美元的交易中被私有化
item.description: 鞋业公司 Skechers 周一表示，已同意被投资公司 3G Capital 收购，交易价值 94 亿美元。【原文：Footwear company Skechers said on Monday it had agreed to be acquired by investment firm 3G Capital in a deal worth $9.4 billion.】

item.title: 印度 IT 公司 Coforge 盈利不及预期，原因是成本增加
item.description: 印度 Coforge 公司公布的第四季度利润低于预期，原因是这家 IT 服务公司受到了支出增加的影响。【原文：India's Coforge posted fourth-quarter profit below estimates, as the IT services company was hurt by increased expenses.】

item.title: 康明斯因关税问题撤回 2025 年财务预测
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）全面征收进口关税带来的不确定性不断增加，康明斯周一撤回了其年度预测，与其他汽车制造商一起重新评估预期。【原文：Cummins withdrew its annual forecast on Monday, joining other vehicle manufacturers that are reassessing expectations as the industry grapples with the mounting uncertainty generated by U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping import tariffs.】

item.title: 皮博迪或因煤矿受损退出英美资源集团资产交易
item.description: 皮博迪能源公司（Peabody Energy）周一表示，如果涉及英美资源集团（Anglo American）莫兰巴北部煤矿的问题得不到满意的解决，该公司可能会选择终止收购这家英国矿业公司在澳大利亚的部分炼钢煤资产的交易。【原文：Peabody Energy said on Monday if issues involving Anglo American's Moranbah North mine were not resolved to its satisfaction, it may elect to terminate its pending deal to acquire some of the British mining company's Australian steelmaking coal assets.】

item.title: MTN 南非公司旨在通过经济型智能手机提高 4G 采用率
item.description: MTN 南非公司表示，在南非准备关闭 2G 和 3G 技术之际，该公司将为 120 万预付费用户提供 4G 智能手机，价格低至 99 兰特（5.42 美元），以支持低收入家庭采用数字技术。【原文：MTN South Africa said it will offer 1.2 million of its prepaid customers 4G smartphones for as little as 99 rand ($5.42) to support digital adoption for low-income households, as the country gears up to switch off 2G and 3G technologies.】

item.title: 尽管电动汽车销量激增，特斯拉 4 月在西班牙的新销量仍下降 36
item.description: 行业组织 ANFAC 周一公布的登记数据显示，特斯拉 4 月份在西班牙的新车销量比 2024 年同期下降了 36%，降至 571 辆，而其他品牌电动汽车的销量则大幅飙升。【原文：Tesla's new car sales in Spain fell 36% in April from the same month in 2024 to 571 vehicles, registration data released by industry group ANFAC showed on Monday, while sales of electric cars from other brands soared.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁对外国制造的电影征收 100% 关税，美国媒体股下跌
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对美国境外生产的所有电影征收 100%的关税，此举可能会大幅提高好莱坞电影公司的成本，并对全球娱乐业造成冲击，美国媒体股周一暴跌。【原文：American media stocks tumbled on Monday after President Donald Trump unveiled a 100% tariff on all movies produced outside the U.S., a move that could sharply raise costs for Hollywood studios and rattle the global entertainment industry.】

item.title: 因收购成本和关税不确定性，Zimmer Biomet 下调 2025 年利润预期
item.description: Zimmer Biomet Holdings 周一下调了全年调整后利润预期，原因是这家医疗器械生产商预计最近对 Paragon 28 的收购、汇率波动和拟议的关税将对其造成冲击。【原文：Zimmer Biomet Holdings on Monday lowered its full-year adjusted profit forecast, as the medical device maker anticipates a hit from its recent acquisition of Paragon 28 , currency volatility, and proposed tariffs.】

item.title: 鸡肉需求强劲，泰森食品公司季度利润超出预期
item.description: 受鸡肉产品需求增加和成本降低的推动，泰森食品公司周一公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期。【原文：Tyson Foods beat Wall Street expectations for second-quarter profit on Monday, driven by increased demand for its chicken products and lower costs.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司旗下电池公司 Novo Energy 将裁员 50
item.description: 沃尔沃汽车公司（Volvo Cars）旗下的诺和诺德能源公司（Novo Energy）周一表示，在瑞典诺斯沃尔特公司（Northvolt）破产后，该公司对其业务进行了评估，并将裁员 50%，以降低成本。【原文：Volvo Cars' Novo Energy said on Monday it will cut its workforce by 50% to reduce costs after an evaluation of its business following the bankruptcy of Sweden's Northvolt, which originally co-owned the battery venture.】

item.title: 欧盟的里贝拉微软董事长称公司将遵守欧盟规则
item.description: 欧盟委员会副主席特雷莎-里贝拉（Teresa Ribera）周一表示，微软公司董事长布拉德-史密斯（Brad Smith）已向欧盟委员会表示，无论是否同意，微软公司都将遵守欧洲规则。【原文：Microsoft Chairman Brad Smith has told the European Commission his company will abide by European rules whether it agrees or not with them, the Commission's Vice President Teresa Ribera said on Monday.】

item.title: 阿克曼的潘兴广场公司将以 9 亿美元增持霍华德-休斯公司股份
item.description: 亿万富翁投资者比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）的潘兴广场资本管理公司（Pershing Square Capital Management）周一表示，将以 9 亿美元的价格购买房地产开发商霍华德-休斯控股公司（Howard Hughes Holdings）新发行的 900 万股股票。【原文：Billionaire investor Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management will buy 9 million newly issued shares of real estate developer Howard Hughes Holdings for $900 million, the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: Sunoco 将以 90 亿美元收购 Parkland，进行燃油分销商整合
item.description: Sunoco LP 周一表示，它将收购总部位于加拿大的 Parkland 公司，包括债务在内的交易价值约为 91 亿美元，此举将创造美洲最大的独立燃料分销商。【原文：Sunoco LP said on Monday it would buy Canada-based Parkland in a deal valued at about $9.1 billion, including debt, in a move that would create the largest independent fuel distributor in the Americas.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，伯克希尔董事会任命格雷格-阿贝尔为首席执行官，巴菲特将继续担任董事会主席
item.description: 据 CNBC 周一援引消息人士的话报道，伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司董事会一致投票决定任命格雷格-阿贝尔从明年开始担任总裁兼首席执行官，而沃伦-巴菲特将继续担任董事长。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway's board voted unanimously to name Greg Abel president and CEO starting next year, while Warren Buffett will stay on as chairman, CNBC reported on Monday, citing sources.】

item.title: 台币创纪录的涨势是贸易战的震荡
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战打击了市场信心并扰乱了贸易关系，台湾货币出现了前所未有的连续两天飙升，这是争相抛售美元的最新一幕，也是市场不安的信号。【原文：An unprecedented two-day surge in Taiwan's currency is the latest leg of a scramble out of the U.S. dollar and signal of disquiet in markets as U.S. President Donald Trump's trade war rattles confidence and disrupts trade relationships.】

item.title: 早间竞价原油觉醒
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 独家报道美国议员通过新法案打击向中国走私英伟达芯片的行为
item.description: 一位美国立法者计划在未来几周内提出立法，以核实像英伟达（Nvidia）制造的人工智能芯片在出售后的位置。【原文：A U.S. lawmaker plans to introduce legislation in coming weeks to verify the location of artificial-intelligence chips like those made by Nvidia after they are sold.】

item.title: 关税扰动前景，美联储决策者料将维持利率稳定
item.description: 美联储无疑将在周三维持利率不变，但由于唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税给经济前景蒙上了不确定性的阴影，这次会议可能是最后一次结果如此简单明了的会议。【原文：The Federal Reserve will doubtless leave interest rates unchanged on Wednesday, but the meeting may be the last where the outcome is so cut and dry with President Donald Trump's tariffs casting a shadow of uncertainty over the economic outlook.】

item.title: 美联储决议周伊始，特朗普加征新关税，美股期货下跌
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普推出新的关税措施，再次引发了市场对全球贸易战影响的担忧，同时市场在等待美联储本周的货币政策决定，美国股指期货周一下跌。【原文：U.S. stock index futures fell on Monday after President Donald Trump reignited concerns about the effects of a global trade war by introducing new tariffs, while markets awaited the Federal Reserve's monetary policy decision this week.】

item.title: 即使中美贸易战的和解看起来遥遥无期，策略师们仍对中国持乐观态度
item.description: 在金融市场寄希望于中美贸易战缓和之际，一些专家警告说，世界上最大的两个经济体在达成协议方面取得有意义的进展可能仍有一段距离。【原文：As financial markets pin their hopes on a de-escalation in the U.S.-China trade war, some experts caution that meaningful progress in striking a deal between the world's two largest economies may still be some way off.】

item.title: 本周央行活动密集，油价暴跌，台币大涨
item.description: 在产油国集团欧佩克+（OPEC+）同意加快石油增产后，周一油价暴跌逾 2%，而在央行密集出台的本周全球市场伊始，台币飙升至近三年高点。【原文：Oil prices tumbled over 2% on Monday after oil producing group OPEC+ agreed to accelerate oil production increases, while Taiwan's dollar surged to almost three-year highs at the start of a central bank-packed week for world markets.】

item.title: 台湾称与美国关税谈判未讨论汇率问题，货币飙升
item.description: 台湾政府周一表示，在台币兑美元汇率飙升之后，上周与美国的关税谈判并未讨论汇率问题，台湾央行也未参与讨论。【原文：Taiwan's government said on Monday that tariff talks with the United States last week did not discuss the exchange rate and Taiwan's central bank has not taken part in the discussions, after the Taiwan dollar surged against the U.S. dollar.】
